# amaprice

amaprice is a terminal-first CLI to check e-commerce prices, track products, and build shared price history automatically.
It starts with Amazon support and expands to Walmart and other major e-commerce stores.

## Canonical Links
- Website: https://amaprice.sh/
- Sitemap: https://amaprice.sh/sitemap.xml
- Full LLM Guide: https://amaprice.sh/llms-full.txt
- GitHub: https://github.com/marcel-heinz/amaprice-cli
- npm: https://www.npmjs.com/package/amaprice

## Product Summary
- Name: amaprice
- Type: CLI / Developer tool
- License: MIT
- Primary users: developers, operators, agent builders, automation workflows
- Primary use case: track product prices over time from terminal scripts or workers

## Store Coverage
- Live now: Amazon
- Next target: Walmart
- Planned after that: additional major e-commerce stores
- Goal: one multi-store, terminal-first tracking workflow

## Install
- Global: npm install -g amaprice
- One-shot: npx amaprice price "https://www.amazon.de/dp/B0DZ5P7JD6"

## Core Commands
- amaprice price [url|asin]
- amaprice track [url|asin] --tier hourly|daily|weekly
- amaprice history [url|asin] --limit N
- amaprice list
- amaprice sync --limit N
- amaprice tier [url|asin] <hourly|daily|weekly>

## Public Interfaces For Agents
Public HTTP endpoints on amaprice.sh:
- POST /api/v1/track-requests
- GET /api/v1/track-requests/:id
- GET /api/v1/products
- GET /api/v1/products/:productId/history
- GET /api/v1/prices/recent
- GET /api/v1/worker-health

The CLI command surface remains the primary automation interface, with website APIs focused on website ingestion and visualization.

## Data + Sync Model (High Level)
- Tracks products by ASIN or URL
- Stores price history snapshots
- Supports tier-based cadence: hourly, daily, weekly
- Includes a background sync worker and worker-health telemetry
